channel.description: Latest Financial News for Cisco Systems, Inc.

item.title: Here’s One Reason Cisco (CSCO) Stock Is Down Today
item.description: [at TheStreet] - Cisco (CSCO) stock is declining after JPMorgan analysts said the company could be negatively affected by Google’s (GOOGL) growing cloud computing services.

item.title: Cisco Should Be Concerned About Google Cloud Progress, Says JP Morgan
item.description: [at Barrons.com] - Rod Hall with J.P. Morgan today reflects on the report today by the Jay Greene of The Wall Street Journal stating that Alphabet’s (GOOGL) Google division is gearing up to announce large new customer wins for its cloud computing service, writing that Cisco Systems (CSCO) should be concerned. Greene, citing multiple unnamed sources, writes that Walt Disney (DIS) will be among several high-profile announcements during a “Google Cloud Platform” conference that kicks off in San Francisco today.

Molex and Cisco Help to Lead MSA to Develop Double-Density QSFP Interfaces
item.description: [Business Wire] - At the Optical Fiber Communication Conference in Anaheim, CA, Molex, LLC, and Cisco announced their participation in a multi-supplier agreement to create high-speed, double-density quad small form factor pluggable , a new high-speed interface.

item.title: Cisco Introduces Innovations for Transport Network Modernization
item.description: [at noodls] - Anaheim, Calif., March 22, 2016-Today at the Optical Fiber Communications Conference, Cisco announced innovations in its optical transport portfolio to address service providers' challenges of migrating ...

item.title: Cisco CEO Chuck Robbins sets engineering goals in latest big reorganization
item.description: [at American City Business Journals] - Cisco Systems CEO Chuck Robbins on Monday sent another message that he is ready to revamp the networking equipment giant. The company's engineers are now lining up in four units aimed at where Robbins sees Cisco's biggest opportunities in the future. The fourth will concentrate on applications and the Internet of Things (IoT).
